{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Le Fort I osteotomy is a surgical procedure that involves the maxilla. According to Document [0], the vascular supply of the Le Fort I osteotomy segment is maintained by the ascending palatine branch of the facial artery and the anterior branch of the ascending pharyngeal artery. This is also confirmed in Document [12]. Therefore, the blood supply of the maxilla after Le Fort I osteotomy is maintained by the ascending palatine branch of the facial artery.", "answer_choice": "D.
